page.title: 10STH.SHROPSHIRE HIGHWAYS DEPT
page.content: The Service Department maintains roads and bridges. The roads are made from block stone covered by asphalt or tarmac.They lay down 'cats-eyes' and white lines made from thermo-plastic with Ballatoni reflectors. They also re-cover the roads every three years. The road is re-surfaced; either with a thick layer of asphalt or tarmac by a machine called a Blaw-Knox, or by spraying bitumen and sprinkling chippings and stones on top. In the cold weather they use three thousand tons of salt to cover five hundred miles of road each year. The salt comes from the I.C.I. salt mines in Winsford, Cheshire. Ten years ago, 110 people used to work for the Highways Department, but today they have only 40. The men work a normal day with no shifts, although someone is always on emergency call.
